items.sentence: Tom usually makes two or three cups of tea with one tea bag.
It seems as if I'm the only person here capable of doing it.
I don't floss my teeth as often as my dentist says I should.
I don't think we'll find anybody willing to do that for you.
Tom wasn't able to get everything he needed in his suitcase.
My French teacher told me that I needed to rewrite my essay.
I don't want you to do anything about this until I get back.
I don't spend a lot of time thinking about things like that.
I'm sure that you're going to enjoy yourselves at the party.
How do you make sure that people do what you ask them to do?
